ca.uqac.lif.labpal

Class FileHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.labpal.FileHelper

  • public class FileHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A number of helpful utilities to read, write and manage files
    Author:
    Sylvain Hallé

      • replaceExtension

        public static java.lang.String replaceExtension(java.lang.String filename,
                                                java.lang.String extension)
        Replace the extension of a filename with another. For example, one can replace /my/path/foo.bar with /my/path/foo.baz.
        Parameters:
        filename - The original filename
        extension - The extension to replace with
        Returns:
        The modified filename

      • trimExtension

        public static java.lang.String trimExtension(java.lang.String filename)
        Trims the extension of a filename. For example, with /my/path/foo.bar, would return /my/path/foo
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename
        Returns:
        The filename without the extension

        Parameters:

        path - The path
        Returns:
        The string, or null if the path does not correspond to a resource

                                                                    java.lang.String glob)
        List all files in a folder whose filename matches a regex pattern
        Parameters:
        clazz - A class reference
        directory - The source folder
        glob - The pattern to match
        Returns:
        The list of file names

      • getResourceListing

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getResourceListing(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                                                  java.lang.String path,
                                                                  java.lang.String glob)
        List directory contents for a resource folder. Not recursive. This is basically a brute-force implementation. Works for regular files and also JARs. Original code by Greg Briggs.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Any java class that lives in the same place as the resources you want.
        path - Should end with "/", but not start with one.
        glob - The pattern to match
        Returns:
        Just the name of each member item, not the full paths.

      • getResourceListing

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getResourceListing(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                                                  java.lang.String path,
                                                                  java.lang.String glob,
                                                                  java.lang.String exclude_glob)
        List directory contents for a resource folder. Not recursive. This is basically a brute-force implementation. Works for regular files and also JARs. Original code by Greg Briggs.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Any java class that lives in the same place as the resources you want.
        path - Should end with "/", but not start with one.
        glob - The pattern to match
        exclude_glob - The pattern to exclude files
        Returns:
        Just the name of each member item, not the full paths.

      • internalFileToString

        public static java.lang.String internalFileToString(java.lang.Object o,
                                                    java.lang.String filename)
        Gets a string from an internal file
        Parameters:
        o - The object used as reference. The path is expressed relative to the location of the object's declaring class in the project.
        filename - The path
        Returns:
        The string, or null if the path does not correspond to a resource or if o is null

      • mergePdf

        public static byte[] mergePdf(java.lang.String dest,
                              java.lang.String... paths)
        Merges multiple PDF files into a single file
        Parameters:
        dest - The destination filename
        paths - The input files
        Returns:
        The array of bytes containing the merged PDF
